title: 111_hr2126
content: The Act may be cited as the "Correspondence With Our Heroes Act" and includes a Postal Benefits Program for Members of the Armed Forces. The "Correspondence With Our Heroes Act" establishes a Postal Benefits Program for qualified individuals who are active duty members of the Armed Forces serving in Iraq or Afghanistan or hospitalized due to service-related injuries. The Postal Benefits Program provides vouchers for qualified mailings free of postage for active duty members of the Armed Forces in Iraq or Afghanistan or hospitalized due to service-related injuries. Qualified mailings must be sent from a US post office to a qualified individual. The Postal Benefits Program offers vouchers for free postage on qualified mailings for active duty members in Iraq or Afghanistan or hospitalized due to service-related injuries. The described mail includes first-class mail not exceeding 13 ounces and parcel post not exceeding 15 pounds. Individuals are limited to one voucher per month and each voucher can only be used for a single qualified mailing before the expiration date designated by the Secretary. The Postal Benefits Program provides vouchers for free postage on qualified mailings for active duty members in Iraq or Afghanistan or hospitalized due to service-related injuries. Vouchers can be used for first-class mail or parcel post within specified weight limits. Regulations for the program will be prescribed by the Secretary of Defense within 30 days of the Act's enactment. Procedures for timely provision of vouchers to qualified individuals and ensuring compliance with voucher limits. SEC. 3. FUNDING. The Department of Defense is authorized to appropriate funds for providing benefits as described in section 2(c). Funds will be transferred to the Postal Service in advance of each quarter based on estimated postal benefits usage. The Department of Defense consults with the Postal Service to estimate and determine the amount of postal benefits needed, with a final determination made within 6 months after the end of a 1-year period. The postal benefits under this Act will be applicable to mail sent within a 1-year period from the date when the regulations under section 2(d) become effective.
